message: Hello kid. Please leave me to my mourning.

replies.text: Do you want to talk about it?

message: Oh, it's so sad. I really don't want to talk about it.
Well, I guess it's ok to tell you. You seem to be a nice enough kid.
My friend Gandir, his friend Irogotu, and I were down here digging this hole. We had heard there was a hidden treasure down here.
We started digging and finally broke through to the cave system below. That's when we discovered them. The critters and bugs.

Oh those critters. Damn bastards. Nearly killed me they did.

Gandir and I told Irogotu that we should stop the digging and leave while we still could.
But Irogotu wanted to continue deeper into the dungeon. He and Gandir got into an argument and started fighting.

That's when it happened.

*sob*

Oh what have we done?
Irogotu killed Gandir with his bare hands. You could see the fire in his eyes. He almost seemed to enjoy it.
I fled and haven't dared go back down there because of the critters and Irogotu himself.
Oh that damn Irogotu. If only I could get to him. I'd show him one thing and another.

replies.text: Do you think I could help?

message: Do you think you could help me?

replies.text: Sure, there may be some treasure in this for me.
Sure. Irogotu should pay for what he did.
No thanks, I would rather not be involved in this. It sounds dangerous.

message: Really? You think you could help? Hm, maybe you could. Beware of those bugs though, they're really tough bastards.
If you really want to help, go find Irogotu down in the cave, and get me back Gandir's ring.

replies.text: Can you tell me the story again?

message: Return to me when you are done. Bring me Gandir's ring from Irogotu down in the cave.
Hello again kid. Did you find Irogotu down in the cave?

replies.text: Can you tell me your story again?

message: Didn't you listen the first time I told you the story? Do I really have to tell you the story one more time?

replies.text: Yes, please tell me the story again.
I wasn't listening that much the first time you told it. What was that about a treasure?
No, never mind. I remember it now.

message: Thanks for dealing with Irogotu earlier! I am forever in debt to you.

Wait, what? You actually went down there and returned alive? How did you manage that? Wow, I almost died going into that cave.

Oh thank you so much for bringing me back Gandir's ring! Now I can have something to remember him by.

replies.text: Glad that I could help. Goodbye.
Whatever. I only did it for the loot.

message: Well hello there. Another adventurer coming to steal my bounty. This is MY CAVE. The treasure will be MINE!
That whelp Gandir? He was in my way. I merely used him as a tool to dig deeper into the cave.
Besides, I never really liked him anyway.

replies.text: I guess he deserved to die. Did he have a ring on him?
Jan mentioned something about a ring?

message: NO! You cannot have it. It's mine! And who are you anyway kid, coming down here to disturb me?!

replies.text: I'm not a kid anymore! Now give me that ring!
Give me that ring and we might both come out of here alive.

message: No. If you want it you will have to take it from me by force, and I should tell you that my powers are great. Besides, you probably wouldn't dare fight me anyway.

replies.text: Very well, let's see who dies here.
By the Shadow, Gandir will be avenged.
